page.title: 08Ecology of the Wishford area
page.content: Wishford and Stapleford lie in the Wylye Valley,surrounded by downs.The downs are intensively farmed and natural grassland has largely been replaced by cereal crops.In the valley many water meadows still exist though some have been ploughed and planted.In some cases the destruction of old drainage channels leads to small scale flooding of this land in the winter. The villages of Stapleford and Wishford are both classified as conservation areas and Ebsbury Wood is listed as a nature conservancy area. Rights of way go from Wishford to Haddon Hill and Ebsbury Hill.At Stapleford there are rights of way to Stapleford Down and Yarnbury Castle. Another path crosses the area in N.W. The R.Wylye and lakes near Steeple Langford are stocked with fish and ducks and swans visit these waters.
